wiki.content: "Girls, Girls, Girls" is the second single from rapper Jay-Z's album The Blueprint. It is a playful description of the artist's promiscuous lifestyle. The song contains a sample of "There's Nothing in This World That Can Stop Me From Loving You" by Tom Brock The remix is composed of new verses by Jay-Z, a new instrumental sampling "Trying Girls Out" by The Persuaders and uncredited vocals from Michael Jackson. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Girls, Girls, Girls" is the second single from rapper Jay-Z's album The Blueprint. It is a playful description of the artist's promiscuous lifestyle. The song contains a sample of "There's Nothing in This World That Can Stop Me From Loving You" by Tom Brock The remix is composed of new verses by Jay-Z, a new instrumental sampling "Trying Girls Out" by The Persuaders and uncredited vocals from Michael Jackson.

track.name: Girls, Girls, Girls
comments: Only Jay-Z song I listen to anymore. Awesome production & sample
I listened to this song, trying to see if I could spot Michael Jackson at all.
chorus sucks. GUHRLS GUHRLS GUHRLS GUHRLS, GUHRLS I DO ADOHHHRE
Soulful ass beat, love it. Jay-Z did it justice, but one can only imagine what Ghostface would've done to it.

great sample, fun rhymes, AWFUL sounding chorus. what a shame. still gotta love it, though!
[2]
this song is gold and so is lil b's version
great sample, fun rhymes, AWFUL sounding chorus. what a shame. still gotta love it, though!
